column1: Everard was the youngest son of [[Adelard Took]].<ref>{{App
column3: 1401}}, he danced the [[Springle-ring]] with [[Melilot Brandybuck]] when he thought the Speech was over.<ref>{{FR

column1: The meaning is "boar-strong" (''ever'' + ''hard'').<ref>[[Jim Allan]] (ed.), ''[[An Introduction to Elvish]]'', "Giving of Names"</ref>
Everard's name was originally 'Prospero' until [[J.R.R. Tolkien
column2: Tolkien]]'s sixth draft version of [[A Long-expected Party]].<ref>{{RS
